page.title: 11A LOCAL FACTORY
page.content: 50 years ago in 1935 a food and drinks factory was built outside Milnthorpe in grid square 51,81.This factory was the property of Libby & McNeil a company formed in 1868 by the two Libby brothers and a mman called McNeil.The reasons for the siting of the factory were mainly because of the high quality milk produced in the area by the mainly local farmers.This milk was to become the raw material for Libby's famous evaporated milk to be produced on the site.Another influence was the mainline London_Glasgow railway which had a station next to the site and so provided a good means of transport the products to holding depots at Warrington,Chepstow,Edmunton,Merton, Southampton,Exeter,Glasgow and Wakefield before being distributed to the shops.Two other factors were the
